forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Cloudy. High near 68, with temperatures falling to around 65 in the afternoon. South southwest wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 7pm, then rain and a chance of thunderstorms. Cloudy, with a low around 62. South wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Evanston, the current conditions present a rather humid and cloudy afternoon, with temperatures comfortably in the upper 60s. The breeze is brisk, providing a fresh, invigorating touch against the backdrop of Lake Michigan. With rain on the horizon, it seems the day will shift towards more unsettled weather, as forecasters predict cloud cover to deepen with a chance of rain arriving before evening. This chance intensifies into a likely scenario tonight, accompanied by possible thunderstorms and a drop in temperatures to the low 60s.

Such atmospheric conditions give the beach scene a muted, yet serene quality, but one may find the waters somewhat choppy as waves gather energy from the gusty winds. Precipitation amounts could reach three-quarters of an inch, which may make outdoor plans less appealing. Ideal attire would lean towards layers, with a light jacket being recommended to ward off the cool breeze, particularly as evening approaches. Given the current season, these temperatures are typical for early November in the Midwest, signaling the gradual shift into winter. As the clouds roll in and rain threatens, indoor activities may be best—consider visiting local cafes or museums to escape the elements while still enjoying the charm of Evanston during this transitional season.
